bug.author: Trojahn
bug.summary: opencv_world: Unable to compile opencv 3.1 with nonfree xfeatures2d module
bug.description:
I'm unable to compile Opencv with xFeatures2D contrib module without CUDA support. Running the following cmake comand: <denchmark-code>cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr/local -DOPENCV_EXTRA_MODULES_PATH=../../opencv_contrib/modules -DWITH_EIGEN=ON -DWITH_FFMPEG=ON -DWITH_JASPER=ON -DWITH_JPEG=ON -DWITH_PNG=ON -DWITH_V4L=ON -DWITH_LIBV4L=ON -DWITH_XINE=ON -DBUILD_PACKAGE=ON -DBUILD_OPENCV_PYTHON3=ON -DPYTHON2_NUMPY_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/numpy/core/include -DPYTHON3_NUMPY_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/numpy/core/include -DINSTALL_CREATE_DISTRIB=ON -DWITH_CUDA=OFF .. </denchmark-code>
Gives that: <denchmark-code>-- OpenCV modules: -- To be built: core flann imgproc ml photo video imgcodecs shape videoio highgui objdetect superres features2d calib3d stitching videostab world xfeatures2d ximgproc xobjdetect xphoto aruco bgsegm bioinspired ccalib dnn dpm face fuzzy line_descriptor optflow plot reg rgbd saliency stereo structured_light surface_matching text ts datasets tracking -- Disabled: contrib_world -- Disabled by dependency: - -- Unavailable: cudaarithm cudabgsegm cudacodec cudafeatures2d cudafilters cudaimgproc cudalegacy cudaobjdetect cudaoptflow cudastereo cudawarping cudev java python2 viz cvv hdf matlab sfm </denchmark-code>
When compiling the result are this: <denchmark-code>In file included from /home/user/deps/opencv/modules/stitching/include/opencv2/stitching.hpp:49:0, from /home/user/deps/opencv/modules/stitching/src/precomp.hpp:59, from /home/user/deps/opencv/modules/stitching/src/matchers.cpp:43: /home/user/deps/opencv/modules/stitching/include/opencv2/stitching/detail/matchers.hpp:52:42: fatal error: opencv2/xfeatures2d/cuda.hpp: No such file or directory </denchmark-code>
Ok, after removing the stitching module (do i really need to???)... <denchmark-code>cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr/local -DOPENCV_EXTRA_MODULES_PATH=../../opencv_contrib/modules -DWITH_EIGEN=ON -DWITH_FFMPEG=ON -DWITH_JASPER=ON -DWITH_JPEG=ON -DWITH_PNG=ON -DWITH_V4L=ON -DWITH_LIBV4L=ON -DWITH_XINE=ON -DBUILD_PACKAGE=ON -DBUILD_OPENCV_PYTHON3=ON -DPYTHON2_NUMPY_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/numpy/core/include -DPYTHON3_NUMPY_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/numpy/core/include -DINSTALL_CREATE_DISTRIB=ON -DWITH_CUDA=OFF -DBUILD_opencv_stitching=OFF .. </denchmark-code>
Gives me this error: <denchmark-code>/home/user/deps/opencv/modules/world/src/precomp.hpp:57:43: fatal error: opencv2/xfeatures2d/nonfree.hpp: No such file or directory </denchmark-code>
Which IS present as seems below: <denchmark-code>user@pc:~/deps/opencv/release$ ls ../../opencv_contrib/modules/xfeatures2d/include/opencv2/ xfeatures2d xfeatures2d.hpp </denchmark-code>
So, what should i do next? And why do stitching modules crashes even with CUDA explicity disabled? :)

comments.comment:
Thank you for report! Try to clean build directory and rerun CMake without this option:
-DINSTALL_CREATE_DISTRIB=ON
or additionally turn off opencv_world mode:
-DBUILD_opencv_world=OFF
(opencv_world can't be built with opencv_contrib modules at this moment)

Just checked, building without CUDA and OpenCL support (second one disabled to get faster finished test build) it ran into 100% success with latest master branch of both OpenCV and OpenCV contrib repo on Ubuntu 16.04 x64. Did not disable any parameters of the CMAKE but used cmake-gui to confirm all dependencies are actually found. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/StevenPuttemans>@StevenPuttemans</denchmark-link> There is difference in "BUILD_opencv_world" option, which is turned on via flag. This flag causes a mentioned problem.
Aha! Looked over that :P

Tried the proposed solution (below) and almost worked... <denchmark-code>cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr/local -DOPENCV_EXTRA_MODULES_PATH=../../opencv_contrib/modules -DWITH_EIGEN=ON -DWITH_FFMPEG=ON -DWITH_JASPER=ON -DWITH_JPEG=ON -DWITH_PNG=ON -DWITH_V4L=ON -DWITH_LIBV4L=ON -DWITH_XINE=ON -DBUILD_PACKAGE=ON -DBUILD_OPENCV_PYTHON3=ON -DPYTHON2_NUMPY_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/numpy/core/include -DPYTHON3_NUMPY_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/numpy/core/include -DBUILD_opencv_world=OFF -DWITH_CUDA=OFF .. </denchmark-code>
At "100%" the following error shows up: <denchmark-code>Linking CXX executable ../../bin/opencv_interactive-calibration /usr/bin/ld: CMakeFiles/opencv_interactive-calibration.dir/frameProcessor.cpp.o: undefined reference to symbol '_ZN2cv12cornerSubPixERKNS_11_InputArrayERKNS_17_InputOutputArrayENS_5Size_IiEES7_NS_12TermCriteriaE' /home/user/deps/opencv/release/lib/libopencv_imgproc.so.3.1: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status apps/interactive-calibration/CMakeFiles/opencv_interactive-calibration.dir/build.make:219: recipe for target 'bin/opencv_interactive-calibration' failed make[2]: *** [bin/opencv_interactive-calibration] Error 1 CMakeFiles/Makefile2:6722: recipe for target 'apps/interactive-calibration/CMakeFiles/opencv_interactive-calibration.dir/all' failed make[1]: *** [apps/interactive-calibration/CMakeFiles/opencv_interactive-calibration.dir/all] Error 2 Makefile:147: recipe for target 'all' failed make: *** [all] Error 2 </denchmark-code>

Thanks! Looks like opencv_imgproc is missing in linker command line. Could you try to change this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/73a8fa8e6e50660a671620563156b8d7cddecf82/apps/interactive-calibration/CMakeLists.txt#L1>line</denchmark-link> (add opencv_imgproc):
set(OPENCV_INTERACTIVECALIBRATION_DEPS opencv_core opencv_imgproc opencv_aruco opencv_highgui opencv_calib3d opencv_videoio)
and build again.
